the three fda-approved meds for alcohol use disorder are disulfiram, acamprosate calcium, and naltrexone (oral or long-acting injectable). each have their risks/benefits. additionally, there are many behavioral interventions that can help people who wish to reduce/stop drinking.

though i’m done with pnap/phmp, these issues are still near and dear to me, and i would like to get active with changing policies in particular areas — and this seems like an important time.

it would be terrible for healthy participants to become infected due to being in a waiting room with others who are positive, and then bringing that home to their families, out into the community, and back to work in whatever realm they are working (healthcare or otherwise).

in the same respect, i think drugscreening should be limited (if not eliminated) for a period of time. urgent care facilities are likely going to experience influx of people who may not realize their symptoms are due to coronavirus.

i was thinking about this because many meetings are being cancelled, so access may be limited. additionally, i wouldn’t be keen on attending in-person meetings as i’m committed to socialdistancing as much as possible at this time.
